Articles.Content:
Guys, I found a bug in the game.

I was trying to land on Kerbol, and every time I get close to land my rocket keeps exploding.

I know its supposed to be the sun, and its hot and all, which I totally forgot the first few times I tried. But then I waited until its night time so that it's cooler, but its still as bright as ever. I tried this for a couple of nights in a row and my craft still keeps exploding for no reason at all. Now I'm going to try one more time tomorrow night.

If it doesn't work I'm going to scream at someone.

From the wiki and I think this is right but not positive

 

Landing

It's impossible to land on the Sun, even with "Ignore max temperature" cheats enabled. Any objects are destroyed at an altitude below -250 m, which shows in the end flight dialog as "crashed into the surface of the sun" or similar, rather than ever landing.

One can attempt to place edited parts on the surface, but they bounce erratically at a few hundred to a few thousand meters per second if they do not explode.

I tried again. Still doesn't work.

 

Gonna ask for refund.

 

p.s. Kevin doesn't understand this post.

1 minute ago, CMH said:

I tried again. Still doesn't work.

 

Gonna ask for refund.

 

p.s. Kevin doesn't understand this post.

Are you alligned with Kerbin when landing? It's not night everywhere on the sun, just at the part that is visible from Kerbin.

Didn't think of that.

Will go and try.

 

Didn't think it'll be so hard to do what North Korea managed to do.

u know there are nazis on the dark side of the sun? u might want to consider this before landing!

Edited October 21, 2016 by Speadge

There cannot be Nazis.

 

The Great Leader Kim Jong Un would have vanquished them all when they went there!

Or made allies of them. One or the other.

Wait until a solar eclipse, so the mun blocks the light coming from Kerbin. Then it should be cool enough. Have you been using parachutes? I would highly recommend, because the atmosphere is very thin on kerbol, so your parachutes should work. I also realized, that the black spots on kerbol are great spots for landing, as you can find a ton of ores there, and also a couple of eastereggs ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

I wish you good luck m9!

5 hours ago, CMH said:

I tried again. Still doesn't work.

 

Gonna ask for refund.

 

p.s. Kevin doesn't understand this post.

Apparently not ! lol Sorry for my intrusion

*psst*

Spoiler

Just join in the fun.

 

20 minutes ago, Karol van Kermin said:

Wait until a solar eclipse, so the mun blocks the light coming from Kerbin. Then it should be cool enough. Have you been using parachutes? I would highly recommend, because the atmosphere is very thin on kerbol, so your parachutes should work. I also realized, that the black spots on kerbol are great spots for landing, as you can find a ton of ores there, and also a couple of eastereggs ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

I wish you good luck m9!

Solar eclipse! That must be the trick!

 

And easter eggs? Its almost Xmas, why are we talking Easter already?

You know, that when a blue moon occurs, the moon turns into water right?

When a blue moon occurs, use the water to help cool your landing spot, easy as that!

I got close and had a good look at the times when there's a kerbol eclipse, and during a blue moon.

 

I think I saw smurfs down there. Not 100% sure. Will need to be able to zoom harder.

 

Will update with details.

7 hours ago, CMH said:

I got close and had a good look at the times when there's a kerbol eclipse, and during a blue moon.

 

I think I saw smurfs down there. Not 100% sure. Will need to be able to zoom harder.

 

Will update with details.

I managed to land on kerbol today. I was using 32 (33 im not quite sure) Ion thrusters and 3 parachutes. These dudes arent smurfs. I managed to take a closer look at them and they were also so nice to allow me using their launchpad (which is much better than that one at KSC). Nvm. do you know the song Im Blue? This is the species of monsters they are. If you dont know this song, its pretty mlg, and I would highly recommend to watch it. This is actually a clip from my attempt landing on kerbol (I cut out the kerbol landing, because my cam suddenly stopped):

 

 

Edited October 21, 2016 by Karol van Kermin
